turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: Doctor, I've been having chest pain for 2 days, worse when I exercise.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Do you have any allergies to medications?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: Yes, I'm allergic to penicillin. No other drug allergies.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: What medications are you currently taking?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: I take metformin for diabetes and amlodipine for blood pressure.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Any fever, nausea, or shortness of breath?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: No fever, no nausea, but I do get short of breath during the chest pain episodes.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Based on your symptoms, this sounds like stable angina. I'll prescribe aspirin 100mg daily and schedule a follow-up in 2 weeks.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: If you experience chest pain at rest or severe shortness of breath, go to the emergency room immediately.
